intro: Markhamia stipulata var. canaense, commonly known as the white-flowered markhamia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal regions and is well adapted to dry conditions. The varietal form canaense is distinguished by its more elongated leaves and slightly different flower structure compared to the typical variety.
